author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā sāriputtena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Mahāmoggallāna sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:
“Reverend Sāriputta, there are four ways of practice.

segments.pli: Dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, dukkhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā.
segments.en:
1. Painful practice with slow insight,
  2. painful practice with swift insight,
  3. pleasant practice with slow insight, and
  4. pleasant practice with swift insight.
These are the four ways of practice.

segments.pli: Imāsaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ paṭipadānaṃ katamaṃ te paṭipadaṃ āgamma anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuttan”ti?
segments.en: Which one of these four ways of practice did you rely on to free your mind from defilements by not grasping?”

segments.pli: Dukkhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, dukkhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā dandhābhiññā, sukhā paṭipadā khippābhiññā.
Imāsaṃ, āvuso, catunnaṃ paṭipadānaṃ yāyaṃ paṭipadā sukhā khippābhiññā, imaṃ me paṭipadaṃ āgamma anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimuttan”ti.
segments.en: I relied on the pleasant practice with swift insight to free my mind from defilements by not grasping.”
